Crayola announced the retirement of the: dandelion" colored crayon from its box of 24 basic crayon colors on National Crayon Day in 2017.
The decision to remove the: dandelion" color was not influenced by complaints from the White House or any connection to President Trump.
Crayola has a history of switching out h: with the introduction of "dandelion" in 1990 and subsequent changes in 2003.
The claim of the White House complaining: dandelion" color to create unflattering portraits of President Trump was a satirical spoof and not based on any factual events.
